definition: condition characterized by thirst, hunger, frequent urination and weight loss, identified in TCM with type 2 diabetes
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: Traditional Chinese Medicine Committee of Diabetes.
sentences.chinese: 中国中医药学会消渴病专业委员会。

sentences.english: Provides a theoretical basis for Physicians in Research and Treatment about Diabetes.
sentences.chinese: 为后世医家对于消渴病的研究与治疗提供了理论依据。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To establish an HPLC method for determining glibenclamide in Xiaokeping granules.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立测定消渴平颗粒中格列本脲含量的方法。

sentences.english: The basic pathogenesis of diabetes is dryness-heat due to deficiency of yin.
sentences.chinese: 消渴病的基本病机是阴虚燥热。

sentences.english: The modern TCM believes that Yin deficiency and dryness-heat is the basic pathogenesis of wasting thirst.
sentences.chinese: 现代中医学认为，“阴虚燥热”是消渴病的基本病机。

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo observe the therapeutic effect of Xiaoke Shen an capsule on diabetic nephropathy.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察消渴肾安胶囊治疗糖尿病肾病的疗效。

sentences.english: Trditionl Chinese Medicine Committee of Dibetes.
sentences.chinese: 神州中医药学会消渴病专业委员会。

sentences.english: Therefore the Chinese medicine treats diabetes often by "the three urinary deficiencies" the argument.
sentences.chinese: 所以中医治疗消渴病常以“三消”立论。

definition: (TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
illness having to do with obstruction of urine flow/(Chinese medicine)/retention of urine
deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
blocked or painful urination, constipation and vomiting (Chinese medicine)
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
